name: 王聖銘
objective: This course is to explore the fields of interaction design, interactive media and interactive art and focus on the literature study, paper discussion and case studies. With panel discussion, research report and design practice, graduate students can be able to learn the ability of research, analysis and practice by effectively exchange opinions and personal experience. The aim of interaction design is to integrate different disciplines from computer science, mechatronics, human-culture and design and art so as to foster the profession of interaction design. Therefore, one of the aims of this course is to construct multi-disciplines learning environment which performs a topic-oriented study model. This study model formulates the graduate students of design, art, information and mechatronic disciplines to collaborate on an interactive media design project. It may execute interaction design by working with the form of the case study or design creation.
schedule:
Design studio helps to develop student’s research abilities to identify problems, envision current and future needs, and provide validated solutions to these problems and needs through interaction design.

Week 01-03  Introduction
Week 04-09  Problem 1
Week 10-18  Problem 2
materials: Kim Erwin, Communicating the New, Methods to Shape and Accelerate Innovation, John Wiley and Sons, Inc. 2014

name: 吳可久
objective:
Interaction design is "the practice of designing interactive digital products, environments, systems, and services.” (Cooper, Alan; Reimann, Robert; Cronin, Dave (2007). About Face 3: The Essentials of Interaction Design. Indianapolis, Indiana: Wiley. p. 610.) In other words, it is to use digital technologies to create new ways of “interaction” to make a better living for human. As a result, a successful first step of interaction design lies on how to identify the new needs of interaction and then follow by how to design those interactions.
This studio project is therefore divided into two phases by asking interacting “what”? and then “how” to interact. You will be asked to develop a problem proposal that illustrates the new behavioral pattern from your study by the midterm; and propose a solution with techniques of interaction design of your choice to conclude this term project.
schedule:
Pattern Language: A Pattern Language is a classic book authored by Christopher Alexander, published in 1977. It details 253 different human behavioral patterns relate to different scales of built environment along with a design suggestion to accommodate those observed patterns. In this explorational phase, we will go out to examine whether if those observed patterns remain unchanged 30 years later, and what are the new emerged patterns that require design attention?

The Design of Everyday Things: Donald Norman introduces user-centered design in this book, he applied the concept of affordance proposed by J.J Gibson into the field of design. You are encouraged to read this book and understand the essence of user-centered design to help to frame the design solution for the problem you identified through human pattern studies.

Week 01 Introduction
Week04 Pattern Language Field trip
Week05 Service Design & Interactive Technologies
Week06 HCI
Week09 Midterm Review
Week18 Show & Tell
scorePolicy:
Interaction Design:
There are many emerging design fields relates to interaction design, such as UI, UX, Service Design, Tangible Interaction, AR, VR, Smart Environment and so on so forth. Different field of design requires different digital techniques and have different range of influence on human behavior of groups with different scales. To conclude this studio, you are expected to develop a working prototype to provide the interaction for the new pattern you proposed.
materials:
Alexander, Christopher, Sara Ishikawa, Murray Silverstein, Max Jacobson, Ingrid Fiksdahl-King, and Shlomo Angel (1977). “A Pattern Language: Towns, Buildings, Construction”. New York: Oxford University Press, 1977.
Norman, Donald (1988). "Preface to the 2002 Edition". The Design of Everyday Things. New York: Basic Books.

name: 陳圳卿
objective: From the point of perception, examining the relation between human and digital media. Review its current design applications and explore the future research topics. Technologically, this course introduces the recent developments on digital representations and their related technologies. Theoretically, this course reviews the theories and methodologies of the research applications in the field of design that involves human interaction.
